description: Controls whether scrolling movements (triggered by j, k, h, l and related commands) should animate smoothly to their destination or jump instantly. When enabled, scroll animations are calculated with a duration proportional to the scroll distance. When disabled, scrolling uses instant 'behavior' for immediate position changes. This setting affects the visual user experience of all scroll operations.
valueDescription: true enables smooth animated scrolling, false disables animation and scrolls instantly

values.description: Default value; smooth scrolling is enabled with animation duration calculated as Math.max(100, 20 * Math.log(Math.abs(distance)))
Smooth scrolling is disabled; scrollBy uses instant behavior for immediate scrolling without animation

notes: When enabled, the smoothScroll setting works in conjunction with scrollStepSize to determine both the distance and duration of scroll animations. The animation duration is logarithmically scaled (Math.max(100, 20 * Math.log(Math.abs(distance)))) to provide consistent animation speed regardless of scroll distance. When disabled, scrolling behaves instantly with no animation. The setting also interacts with scrollFriction for continuous scroll behavior when keys are held down.
